alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 22 at 4:07AM MST until December 24 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 6 to 12 inches. The heavier accumulations will focus above 8,500 feet. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Tusas Mountains Including Chama, and Jemez Mountains. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 AM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Check road conditions before heading out. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Colder temperatures and gusty winds arriving Saturday may lead to blowing snow with low visibility through Saturday night.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
